column4: hi, when i try to start compiz i get the following error: Checking for texture_from_pixmap: not present.
but glxinfo says, this ext is present
no it doesn't :)
glxinfo must list it three times for it to be present
you mean in client, server and opengl extensions?
server, client, and "GLX extensions"
what video card do you have?
ati radeon 9600 xt
which driver are you using?
fglrx
its the driver from ubuntu's 'restricted drivers'
you need to install xserver-xgl then
does xgl support 3d acceleration?
you'll lose direct rendering (although there's a workaround for that to let you run apps on the regular X server)
what kind of workaround?
you can run DISPLAY=:0 myawesomegame
does it mean, that i have to start to x servers? one xorg and one xgl?
that will happen anyway. It's how Xgl works
thx, i'll try it
you could also disable the restricted driver and use AIGLX
but that's no good if you're a gamer
is it possible to write a little script that switches between the fglx and the ati driver and restarts the x-server afterwards?
I guess you could, although it's much easier to just reboot when switching
